Name: Pedicab fares.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to pedicab fares
BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

Summary: This bill would require the Commissioner of Consumer and Worker Protection to set fixed per minute rates for pedicab rides. Such rates would be indexed to inflation in a manner determined by the Commissioner.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Paragraph 2 of subdivision a of section 20-260 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 59 for the year 2012, is amended to read as follows:
      2. Each minute shall be charged at the same rate. The commissioner shall set such rate no later than 6 months after the effective date of the local law that last amended this paragraph. Such rate shall be indexed to inflation in a manner determined by the commissioner.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
